active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare HMAC signatures versus asymmetric cryptography (e.g., EdDSA) for webhook security. Debate trade-offs in performance, key management, security against replay/spoofing attacks, and suitability for event-driven architectures. Address common misconceptions, such as assuming symmetric crypto is always simpler without considering scalability.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Webhook Security Design (Topic Hierarchy: Level 1 Cybersecurity > Level 2 008_Application Security > Level 3 006_API Security > Level 4 006_001_API Security Fundamentals > Level 5 API 005_Architecture and Design Patterns > Level 6 Webhook Security Design). Generate 50-60 high-quality flashcards using the provided schema. Cover all 4 scaffolding layers progressively (10-15 per layer). Distribute across Bloom's levels: 20% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, 30% APPLY/ANALYZE, 30% EVALUATE, 20% CREATE. Integrate active learning concepts (e.g., threats like spoofing/tampering/replay/DoS; mitigations: HMAC/EdDSA, idempotency, rate limiting; comparisons HMAC vs asymmetric). Incorporate: - Prior knowledge: HTTP/TLS, API basics. - Big picture: Event-driven architectures in app security. - Research: Definitions (webhooks as HTTP callbacks), threats (spoofing, tampering, replay, eavesdropping, DoS, secret leakage), best practices (signatures, validation, OAuth caveats). - Voter priorities: Measurable objectives, discussions (HMAC vs EdDSA), peer teaching (threats/mitigations), problem-solving (e-commerce webhook). Follow flashcard schema exactly: - Types: MCQ (4 opts, distractors per protocol), T/F, cloze, short answer. - Distractors: Misconceptions (e.g., HTTPS stops spoofing), partial truths. - Back: Answer + explanation (pedagogy links) + references. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards. Ensure active recall, no hints on front. Make explanations educational for university-level pedagogy.
